qas.question: The Quarter Century Club began in this year.
What is the name of IBM's internal magazine?
In 1925 the first meeting of this group occurred.
What is the Hundred Percent Club composed of?

answers.text: IBM salesmen who meet their quotas

plausible_answers.text: employee sports teams, hosting family outings, and furnishing a company band

qas.question: What employee management practices were first introduced in New Jersey in 1924?
When was the first Atlantic City publication made?
What was the Hundred Percent Club created to boost in 1914?
Starting in 1914, for how many years was the IBM internal publication made?
In what year did the first IBM sports team play in Atlantic City?

context: IBM's employee management practices can be traced back to its roots. In 1914, CEO <a0_0>Thomas J. Watson<a0_0/> boosted <b7_0>company spirit<b7_0/> by creating <b5_0>employee sports teams, hosting family outings, and furnishing a company band<b5_0/>. IBM sports teams still continue in the present day; the IBM Big Blue continue to exist as semi-professional company rugby and American football teams. In <a1_0><b6_0>1924<b6_0/><a1_0/> the Quarter Century Club, which recognizes employees with <b8_0>25<b8_0/> years of service, was organized and the first issue of <a2_0>Business Machines<a2_0/>, IBM's internal publication, was published. In <b9_0>1925<b9_0/>, the first meeting of the <a3_0>Hundred Percent Club<a3_0/>, composed of <a4_0>IBM salesmen who meet their quotas<a4_0/>, convened in Atlantic City, New Jersey.
